Problem:
Analyze the behavior of a complex function \\( z(t) \\) governed by the differential equation \\(\\dot{z} = Pz\\), where P is a constant complex matrix. The evolution of this system is impacted by an integral transform \\( H(z) = \\int_0^T e^{Qt} z(t) dt \\), where Q is another constant complex matrix and T is a fixed end time.

If a function \\( I(z) = e^{Rt} z(t) \\) where R is another constant complex matrix, is applied at a time \\( t_1 \\) as an intervention, is the outcome \\( z(T) \\) at end time T influenced only by P and R and not the initial computation of \\( H(z) \\)?
Explanation: The intervention \\( I(z) \\) alters the trajectory of the system post \\( t_1 \\), impacting \\( z(T) \\) through a combination of the influences from P and R. The complete state at T is a resultant of the initial state evolved by P, modified by R at \\( t_1 \\), and is independent of the initial computation of \\( H(z) \\).
